title: Emergency Wound Care Checklist
description: Critical steps for treating wounds in emergency or survival situations
author: uDOS Knowledge Bank
prerequisites: First aid kit or improvised supplies

items.text: Assess scene safety before approaching
Call for emergency help if available (911)
Wear gloves or improvise barrier protection
Assess wound type and severity
Apply direct pressure to stop bleeding
items.notes: Clean cloth, firm pressure for 5-10 minutes

items.text: Elevate wound above heart if possible
Apply pressure point if direct pressure fails
items.notes: Arm: brachial artery. Leg: femoral artery

items.text: Apply tourniquet only if life-threatening bleeding
items.notes: Last resort. Note time applied. Seek immediate help.

items.text: Wash hands thoroughly with soap and clean water
Rinse wound with clean water
items.notes: Flow water away from wound, not into it

items.text: Remove visible debris with sterilized tweezers
items.notes: Sterilize tweezers with flame or alcohol first

items.text: Clean skin around wound with soap and water
Pat wound dry with clean cloth
Apply antibiotic ointment if available
Cover with sterile gauze or clean cloth
Secure dressing with tape or bandage
items.notes: Snug but not cutting off circulation

items.text: Check circulation below wound (color, warmth, pulse)
Watch for signs of infection over next 24-48 hours
items.notes: Redness, swelling, warmth, pus, fever = infection

items.text: Change dressing daily or when wet/dirty
Seek professional medical care as soon as possible
items.notes: Especially for deep wounds, animal bites, or signs of infection
